title: How to Make Spicy Chicken Alfredo

steps.headline: Slice the chicken breast.
steps.description: Vertically slice the chicken breast so all of it can fit in a large skillet. Cutting the chicken breast helps to ensure the chicken is cooked all the way through.

steps.headline: Season the chicken with the salt and pepper.
steps.description: This will add a little more flavor to each bite. You can use any seasoning you want to the chicken.

steps.headline: Put the 3 tablespoons of oil in a large skillet.
steps.description: Turn on the stove between medium and high heat. Let the oil get hot before you add your chicken.

steps.headline: Cook the chicken.
steps.description: It should take about 10-12 minutes for the chicken to cook, depending on its size. You can also add water to the skillet to stop the chicken from getting crispy.

steps.headline: While the chicken is cooking, boil the water.
steps.description: Put the 4 quarts of water in a large pot and turn the stove between medium and high heat. Wait until the water is bubbling.

steps.headline: Mince the garlic.
steps.description: Remove the layers of papery skin. Cut the garlic vertically and horizontally. How much you use is up to you, but 2 or 3 cloves is recommended.

steps.headline: Add the noodles to the water.
steps.description: It should take about 10-14 minutes to cook the noodles, depending on how firm you like your pasta.

steps.headline: While the noodles are cooking, cut the chicken.
steps.description: You can cut the chicken however you want; if in doubt, try squares about the size of a chicken bouillon cube.

steps.headline: Put the same skillet you used before on the heat again.
steps.description: Let the butter melt; then add the garlic.

steps.headline: Cook the garlic until it softens.
steps.description: This should take about a minute or so.

steps.headline: Add the floor and evaporated milk.
steps.description: Add the floor and evaporated milk to make to Alfredo sauce thick.

steps.headline: Add the parmesan cheese.
steps.description: Wait until the evaporated milk started making little bubbles. Stir thoroughly to make sure there aren't any bumps or clumps.

steps.headline: Add the seasoning.
steps.description: Start with salt and pepper but not too much because you'll use other seasoning too. Use about 1 teaspoon of cayenne, 3 teaspoons of Cajun, and a few shakes of the red crushed peppers. If you want just a little kick, do not use those measurements; start with less.

steps.headline: Drain the noodles and put them in the sauce.
steps.description: Stir to make sure the sauce is spread evenly.

steps.headline: Add the chicken to the noodles and Alfredo sauce.
steps.description: You can either stir the chicken in or just leave it on top. Enjoy!

text: Cooking the Chicken and Pasta Slice the chicken breast. Vertically slice the chicken breast so all of it can fit in a large skillet. Cutting the chicken breast helps to ensure the chicken is cooked all the way through. Season the chicken with the salt and pepper. This will add a little more flavor to each bite. You can use any seasoning you want to the chicken. Put the 3 tablespoons of oil in a large skillet. Turn on the stove between medium and high heat. Let the oil get hot before you add your chicken. Cook the chicken. It should take about 10-12 minutes for the chicken to cook, depending on its size. You can also add water to the skillet to stop the chicken from getting crispy. While the chicken is cooking, boil the water. Put the 4 quarts of water in a large pot and turn the stove between medium and high heat. Wait until the water is bubbling. Mince the garlic. Remove the layers of papery skin. Cut the garlic vertically and horizontally. How much you use is up to you, but 2 or 3 cloves is recommended. Add the noodles to the water. It should take about 10-14 minutes to cook the noodles, depending on how firm you like your pasta. While the noodles are cooking, cut the chicken. You can cut the chicken however you want; if in doubt, try squares about the size of a chicken bouillon cube. Making the Sauce Put the same skillet you used before on the heat again. Let the butter melt; then add the garlic. Cook the garlic until it softens. This should take about a minute or so. Add the floor and evaporated milk. Add the floor and evaporated milk to make to Alfredo sauce thick. Add the parmesan cheese. Wait until the evaporated milk started making little bubbles. Stir thoroughly to make sure there aren't any bumps or clumps. Add the seasoning. Start with salt and pepper but not too much because you'll use other seasoning too. Use about 1 teaspoon of cayenne, 3 teaspoons of Cajun, and a few shakes of the red crushed peppers. If you want just a little kick, do not use those measurements; start with less. Drain the noodles and put them in the sauce. Stir to make sure the sauce is spread evenly. Add the chicken to the noodles and Alfredo sauce. You can either stir the chicken in or just leave it on top. Enjoy! Finished.
